actions.committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Reported to House from the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries with amendment, H. Rept. 94-144.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #131 (370-5).

actions.committee: Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, S. Rept. 94-152.
Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 94-388.
Conference report filed in Senate, S. Rept. 94-331.
House agreed to conference report, roll call #448 (279-143).

official_title: A bill to amend the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 in order to clarify the procedures therein with respect to the preparation of environmental impact statements.

summary.text: (Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 94-388) Provides, under the National Environmental Policy Act, that an environmental impact statement prepared after January 1, 1970, for any major Federal action funded by grants to States, shall not be deemed legally insufficient solely by reason of having been prepared by a State agency or official: (1) if such agency or official has statewide jurisdiction; (2) if the responsible Federal official furnishes guidance and participates in such preparation and independently evaluates such statement prior to its approval and adoption; and (3) after January 1, 1976, the responsible Federal official provides early notification to, and solicits the views of, any other State or any Federal land management entity of any action or any alternative thereto which may have significant impacts upon such State or affected Federal land management entity.

titles.title: A bill to amend the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 in order to clarify the procedures therein with respect to the preparation of environmental impact statements.
